marker
directive in module maps

Description

The marker directive is used to add a google.maps.Marker or RichMarker(html marker) object to an existing map. If both the icon and content are specified it will give the content priority

Usage

as attribute
<ANY marker
     [position]="{expression}"
     control="{object}"
     [events]="{expression|object}"
     [options]="{expression|object}"
     content="{string|htmlString}"
     icon="{string|url}">
   ...
</ANY>

Directive info

  • This directive executes at priority level 100.

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
[position]expression

Expression to evaluate as an object representing the map center. May be in the form of an object containing latitude and longitude properties.

Note: Evaluated on the attribute only. This is not watched on the scope

controlobject

If this attribute is passed it will bind a few methods to the passed object

getMarker()
returns a direct reference to the map of the directive

More to possibly come....

(default: undefined)

[events]expressionobject

Custom events to apply to the map. This is an associative array, where keys are event names and values are handler functions.

[options]expressionobject

Custom map representing the options to be passed to marker options. See MarkerOptions

contentstringhtmlString

The content to be placed in the marker. Will be parsed at the current point in the scope. (required if icon not specified)

(default: undefined)

iconstringurl

The image to be used as an icon (required if content not specified)

(default: undefined)
